metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12352 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Improper access control in BlueZ may allow an unauthenticated user topotentially enable information disclosure via adjacent access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12352` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-122-generic - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-122-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-122-lowlatency - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-122-generic - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-122-lowlatency - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1142-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1142.152
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1146-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1146.156
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1142.152').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1146.156').
